Class BoardGUI

  • java.lang.Object
    • java.awt.Component
      • java.awt.Container
        • java.awt.Window
          • java.awt.Frame
            • javax.swing.JFrame
              • BoardGUI
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.awt.image.ImageObserver, java.awt.MenuContainer, java.io.Serializable, javax.accessibility.Accessible, javax.swing.RootPaneContainer, javax.swing.WindowConstants
    public class BoardGUI
extends javax.swing.JFrame
    This class is for the GUI or View part of the Board Screen. It utilizes Java Swing and Java AWT and extends JFrame. This is the View in the MVC for the game itself.
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

      This method will initiate everything in the BoardGUI such as JPanels, JButton2D, JLabel2D, and more.

      This method gets the image button description of the gridBtn and returns it.

      This method, when called, gets the x and y coordinates in the BoardController and uses that for the gridBtns array and add a blue border around it.

      This method, when called, gets the x and y coordinates in the BoardController and uses that for the gridBtns array and remove the border around it.

      This method changes the whoTurn JLabel to determine whose turn is it now: red or blue.

      This method changes the whoWin JLabel to determine if someone has won.

    • Field Detail

      • grid

        protected javax.swing.JPanel[][] grid
        This 2D array of JPanels serves as the space in each grid in the gridLayout. It will have JButton2D and JLabel2D to occupy it.

      • gridBtns

        protected JButton2D[][] gridBtns
        This attribute is a 2D array of JButton2D. These are the buttons to press and it will have the images of the animals.

      • gridBGs

        protected JLabel2D[][] gridBGs
        This attribute is a 2D array of JLabel2D. These are the labels that will serve as the background of each JPanel grid, and it's basically the terrain.

      • resetBtn

        protected javax.swing.JButton resetBtn
        This would be in the infoPanel and allows the game to be reset and open the randomizer screen.

    • Constructor Detail

      • BoardGUI

        public BoardGUI()
        This constructor will initialize JFrame and the whole GUI component. It will also call in gameboardScreen to initialize the components inside it.

    • Method Detail

      • gameboardScreen

        public void gameboardScreen()
        This method will initiate everything in the BoardGUI such as JPanels, JButton2D, JLabel2D, and more.

      • setListeners

        public void setListeners​(java.awt.event.MouseListener listener)
        This method sets the listeners for all the buttons in BoardGUI. It takes in MouseListener for it.
        Parameters:
        listener - the listener to give the buttons function

      • isSelected

        public void isSelected​(int x,
                       int y)
        This method, when called, gets the x and y coordinates in the BoardController and uses that for the gridBtns array and add a blue border around it. It indicates if the button is selected.
        Parameters:
        x - x value of the button
        y - y value of the button

      • removeSelected

        public void removeSelected​(int x,
                           int y)
        This method, when called, gets the x and y coordinates in the BoardController and uses that for the gridBtns array and remove the border around it.
        Parameters:
        x - x value of the button
        y - y value of the button

      • setImage

        public void setImage​(java.lang.String s,
                     int x,
                     int y)
        This method changes the image of a button in gridBtns. It takes in a string, which is the filename of the image, the x value of button, and the y value of the button.
        Parameters:
        s - filename of the image
        x - x value of the button
        y - y value of the button

      • canMoveHere

        public void canMoveHere​(int x,
                        int y)
        This method gets the x and y values from the controller and indicates if this spot in the gridBtns can be moved on. It will be highlighted yellow.
        Parameters:
        x - x value of the button
        y - y value of the button

      • removeYellow

        public void removeYellow()
        This method removes the yellow border of some gridBtns.

      • getImageBtnDescription

        public java.lang.String getImageBtnDescription​(int x,
                                               int y)
        This method gets the image button description of the gridBtn and returns it.
        Parameters:
        x - x value of the button
        y - y value of the button
        Returns:
        button description

      • setWhoTurn

        public void setWhoTurn​(boolean t)
        This method changes the whoTurn JLabel to determine whose turn is it now: red or blue.
        Parameters:
        t - boolean value to indicate which color's turn is it

      • setWhoWin

        public void setWhoWin​(boolean t)
        This method changes the whoWin JLabel to determine if someone has won.
        Parameters:
        t - boolean value to indicate which color wins
